text: uh hi everyone dothanytouchtano here the
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of the new
trippy red project neon shark
versus pegasus rapper and singer trippy
redd
is back with a deluxe edition of his
album from last year
pegasus basically it's one of those
deals where you get an
entire other album on top of the
album that you had before which has been
a pretty popular trend as of late but
what i'm hearing here is maybe the most
radically different set of deluxe tracks
i've reviewed in recent years
just for a few recent frames of
reference there was nav with the deluxe
edition of good intentions which
just felt like another helping of the
same type of mediocrity
there was also lil uzi vert with eternal
a take whose
very spacey intergalactic vibes played
off of the incredibly punchy
love versus the world too which he
attached to it about a week later but
with neon shark trippy red is taking
things into
rock territory with drummer and producer
of blink 182 fame travis barker who's
had a lot of crossovers into the hip-hop
world as of late like with suicide boys
or
even machine gun kelly who he helped
transition over into a more rock sound
on his latest lp
and he's doing roughly the same thing
here with trippy but the end result is
more varied than i would have expected
neon shark is also a much more groomed
and focused
project than pegasus was too this thing
was such a slog with over 20 tracks of
songs that were so
rift and uninspired it was kind of a
shock that trippy could go as
low effort as he did on that 2019 record
but
somehow stretch that out for over an
hour
so yes pegasus was kind of unfortunate
given how much potential
trippy showed on his early records but
if neon shark vs pegasus
is a competition neon shark beats
pegasus
hands down and even caves pegasus's head
in with a lead pipe
and this is the case for a myriad of
reasons everything here seems to have a
clear sense of purpose and direction
the production on these tracks is pretty
tasteful as well
not only are the mixes on this thing
heavy but travis barker is really
putting in some [ __ ] work
on these drum fills take the track sea
world or the song frozen ocean these
tracks are like travis kicking ass for
three minutes straight maybe my memory
is failing me but i do
not remember travis going this hard on
machine gun kelly's record
there's also the bright and driving
guitars on swimming which i thought were
pretty exhilarating
we get a strong contrast on the song
female shark which is much more watery
and spacious instrumentally and vocally
it sounds like a combination of
i don't know a rick james song but also
like kid cudi speeding bullet to heaven
freaking girl freaky girl
and i mention this track because the
whole record is respectably
varied even though trippy does go rock
the songs don't all blur together
because you have cuts that are
more pop punk more emo more alternative
rock or metal even grunge
so ultimately while there's nothing too
out there in the track list here
at least it's not a one-dimensional
record plus
the way trippy switches up his vocal
inflections and intensity on red sky or
it's coming
really shows that he gets it he is truly
channeling
the intensity of a charismatic rock
front man on these tracks he is paying
attention
to the ferocity that the rock music of
this stripe
kind of needs so yes neon shark in my
opinion
is a refreshing change of pace from
pegasus
and it's even markedly better than
a lot of trippy's recent stuff but
that's not to say that this project
is amazing or that it's not without its
flaws
lo and behold i think many of the flaws
of this project are the same ones that
have plagued much of trippy's recent
work
for one the vocal performances leave a
lot to be desired and listen
i know i just complimented some aspects
of trippy singing on this project
i don't think anybody could come away
from this record saying that trippy
is a boring singer or a shy singer
or a singer without personality he is
certainly loud
and in your face but the performances
he's trying to deliver on this project
require in my opinion a lot more finesse
than i think he has or is willing to
give
nowhere is this more apparent than on
geronimo featuring
chino moreno of deftone's fame the track
even instrumentally kicks off
in typical deftone's fashion but the
incredible talent gap between
chino and trippy is painfully clear by
the first verse
and becomes even clearer by the blasted
out
chorus which sounds like it's packed
with maybe
six vocal layers between both these guys
dissonantly
fighting it out for dominance it is
absolutely awful but even when trippy is
not engaged in
vocal malpractice with a guest on
his record his solo performances
are falling short of the mark too take
the song without you for example which
is not too much
unlike many other songs here on the
vocal front
just all the autotune and the artificial
reverbs and delays as well as the way
trippy just holds onto his notes
like a fog horn it's just a bit much
i would say the vocals on this thing are
in terms of being an utter miss or
cathartic bliss
then there's also the matter of the
songwriting on this thing
much of the structure that i do commend
on this project
really does seem to come down to just
the production
and the change-ups and the drums and the
guitars
this is mostly an issue on the back end
of the lp where trippy
seems to a lot of the time just be
vaguely
gesturing to the idea of a song
rather than a song that he has
conceptualized
take the song that's coming for example
which seems to be loaded with these
lyrical gaps that trippy can't be
bothered to fill
and instead of saying something
compelling during these parts
he's merely just like emoting he's
moaning he's just kind of filling in air
the acoustic and nostalgic cut leaders
suffers from this issue
as well it seems like trippy is kind of
going for something
where he's digging into his past a
little bit but
the track isn't really all that potent
at the end of the day because he doesn't
really seem to have thought through what
he really wants to
communicate so overall i guess i can't
really say i like
this one too much but it still was an
improvement
over a lot of trippy's recent stuff and
i suppose i come away from this project
feeling a little torn because i do like
a lot of the production
i do like a lot of what travis barker
pulled off and there are many moments
where i think
in terms of vocal timbre and vocal
delivery
yeah trippy does kind of fit this style
he complements it well
but simultaneously he also didn't really
go
far enough in terms of honing his vocal
talents
making sure that certain vocal parts
worked in the context of certain songs
and also just like writing these songs
out to be something really
memorable or unique sticky cause yeah
there were tracks where he was vocally
just going through the motions
much in the same way that he would over
a generic trap beat
off of his last record feeling a strong
four to a light five
on this one tran position have you given
this
album a listen did you love it did you
hate it what would you rate it you're
the best you're the best what should i
review next
hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell as well
over here next to my head is another

anthony fantano trippyread travis barker
